TextBlock.Text: POKE: We have failed, Annona. Though the fault does not lie with the warp core I crafted, I cannot help but feel some responsibility. Hypothesis: had I better understood your designs, less energy would have been required.
POKE: However, despite this doubt (and the struggle of living without you), I will press on. Like this tree before me, we Nomai can thrive even in an environment far from our home.

POKE: I depart soon to explore the <Color=lightblue>comet</Color> alongside Pye and Clary. However, when I return, I will investigate any way to reduce the energy the warp core requires (perhaps with more precision...).

POKE: The possibilities of the <Color=orange>Ash Twin Project</Color> still excite me. Once we have found the <Color=lightblue>Eye</Color>, imagine what else we could achieve with this technology! With a negative time interval on this scale, we could potentially duplicate matter (or even one of us).

POKE: I spoke of this to Root outside the <Color=orange>Ash Twin Project</Color> when we installed its warp core. Imagine - temporal clones could be used to temporarily increase the population of our clan. How would it feel to work alongside a future version of yourself?
CLARY: Hypothesis: two of you would be too much for the fabric of spacetime (or me) to handle. Come, sister, the shuttle is almost ready.
